item.title: Privacy Technologies I Use
item.description: Privacy Technologies I Use A few years ago I read Tim Wu’s excellent book, The Attention Merchants, which opened my eyes to the pervasiveness of what’s become known as surveillance capitalism. (The documentary The Social Dilemma also did a great job of highlighting this problem.) Afterward, I basically declared war on advertising in our family’s lives, and deployed a number of technologies on our devices and our home LAN to block as much of it as possible.

item.title: Setting up a blog
item.description: Setting up a blog A couple hours ago I thought that I should set up a blog, and it’s already up and running. Fortunately I already had some of the pieces in place (like a Github account and the domain name), but the whole thing was surprisingly simple. Here are the tools that helped: Hugo - Static website generator Clean White Theme for Hugo - Simple blog theme Github Pages - Free hosting from Github Github Actions - Automated workflows triggered on code changes Github Actions for Hugo - Workflow to execute Hugo’s build and update the site Cloudflare DNS - DNS resolution for my domain Let’s Encrypt - Free TLS certificate, managed by Github
